result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vernissia T Hill

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Vernissia T Hill in court with attorney Jess Martinez.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The charge is dismissed and read into 15CT348.

Defendant Vernissia T Hill in court with attorney Jess Martinez.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant is scheduled to take her test on 12/29/15.    Attorney Martinez is requesting additional time to allow for the Defendant to obtain her license.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Vernissia T Hill in court with attorney Jess Martinez.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Martinez advises the Court the Defendant is still in the process of obtaining her license and is requesting additional time for the Defendant to obtain her license.  The road test is scheduled in mid December.  There is an offer to amend with valid license.  Hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Vernissia T Hill in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez requests an adjournment to allow time for the Defendant to obtain her license.  The Court grants the adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 19, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Vernissia T Hill in court with attorney Jess Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises the defendant is working on obtaining her license. Defendant needs to pay another forfeiture, obtain a SR22 and get her regular license.   Court will give a date in 60 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: August 14, 2015

Defendant Vernissia T Hill in court with attorney Jess Martinez.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises the Defendant is eligible to obtain a license and requests another date in 30 - 45 days. Court will give a date in 45 days. Defense to advise how this matter will proceed on the next date.  Hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Vernissia T Hill
Current: 221 Hinman Ave. #2, Waukesha, WI 53186   (Effective: 06-23-2015)
Prior: 1311 Fleetfoot Dr Apt 202, Waukesha, WI 53186
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Vernissia T Hill in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant is working on obtaining her driver's license.  
  Hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
